text: We will show you how to clean the screens
of an iPhone and a Samsung Galaxy.

In this video, we'll
be cleaning an iPhone X
and a Samsung Galaxy Note20

based on the manufacturer's
recommendations.

For cleaning recommendations
on your specific phone model,
click the link in the description below.
First, power down and unplug your phone.
A clean, lint-free microfiber cloth
is going to be your first cleaning option
to try for both phones

and is great for getting
rid of fingerprints.
If you need some deeper cleaning,
carefully dampen the cloth.
Samsung recommends using distilled water.
Wipe in a small circular motion
to get as much debris as possible.

Be careful to avoid getting
moisture in any openings,
like the charging port or speakers.
To disinfect your phone,

Apple says you can gently use
a Clorox disinfecting wipe.

Here are some further options
that Apple recommends using.
Samsung recommends using these solutions
carefully applied to a microfiber cloth.
Apple and Samsung both advise
that you should not use aerosol sprays,
bleaches, household cleaning products,

or any other solutions
that are not recommended.
Now you can enjoy your clean phone.
